p: The results indicated that intraperitoneal inoculation of mice with 10 6 of PbB-parasitized red blood cells (RBC) led to malaria infection with parasitemia up to 22.03% at the end of experimentation in the negative control group ( Table 2). Tmsb w exhibited significant ( P < 0.05) dose-dependent reduction of parasitemia compared to the negative control after oral administration for five days to infected mice ( Table 2) highlighting the inhibitory effect of Tmsb w on malaria parasite life cycle in this model.
